pros: great benefits, and a caring community
cons: The usual state workers/working hassles

review_title: Great stepping stone, not worth it long term
pros: most employees are friendly and willing to assist one another.
cons: There is little to no value in retaining employees. No upward movement, raises for performance are non-existent. Evaluations (when performed) only note areas to improve. Either satisfactory or needs improvement. "Areas for improvement" must be filled in even if the supervisor has no issues with your work. They will over pay anyone they newly hire but won't compensate employees for additional work when someone leaves.

pros: State University with pension and state benefits and insurance
cons: Decreasing faculty lines makes service hard to manage

review_title: DO NOT WORK HERE(very toxic work environment)
pros: The only pro is the free housing
cons:
Low Pay 

You are not only doing your job but the Directors job as well because he does not know how to do anything!!! 

The GA's are rude and the Director won't do anything about it 

No work-life balance

The Director will come up with ideas and when he gets backlash from it he will throw you under the bus and say it was your idea

The Director does not respect your time and shows up to meetings late 

The Director does not trust his employees ( when he is out of the office he will pop up to "Keep us on our toes" yes he really said that)

pros: Congenial coworkers and work place.
cons: Too much turnover of administrators who leave in the middle of their pet projects.

job_title: Chief Human Resources Officer in Fitchburg, MA
pros: Community, student centered, higher education and the mission to promote our student globally.
cons: seeking more diversity in the student body and staffing

pros: Impacting young people on a daily basis
cons: University is driven by the bottom line, willing to let good people and employees go, while maintaining mediocre employees who don't question or ask for me. No difference in how excellent, average, and below average employees are recognized.

review_title: Don't get into the wrong department
pros: Dedicated front-line staff. Decent union leadership. Good facilities. Interesting programs. Potential for growth.
cons: Administration out of touch. Cliques. Groupthink in certain departments.

pros: Students, faculty, staff and environment
cons: Falling enrollment and public system changes

pros: An overall positive and supportive environment
cons: slow to change, typical higher education silos

pros:
great colleagues and students, academic freedom,
faculty union, most facilities updated, job security
cons: constant underfunding by the state, administrative bloat, ever increasing workload, lacking in diversity, technology support is minimal

pros: The state provides good benefits which college employees enjoy.  Rank and file employees are supportive and nice. Generous sick time and vacation time.
cons: Senior management is harsh and difficult to work for.  They do not train employees well.  It is a sink or swim environment.  It is also very cliquish. Either you are part of the team or you are not and if you are not, they let you know it. The college had a difficult year with getting programs approved.  Instead of admitting their weaknesses, they blamed the system and people working in the school.  It was sad.

pros: Greatly improving physical plant under Bob Antonucci's leadership. So much improvement since he took office. Looking forward to improvement in both administration and work culture.
cons: Confusing and disorganized administration. No training or department orientation upon hire; sink or swim culture in department. Bureaucratic process simply obtaining work-related supplies took up too much time; might be common in State colleges.

pros: Physical plant improvements in recent years. Small-school atmosphere.
cons: Mismanagement throughout most parts of the university. Growing expenditures on new administrative positions, many times at the expense of the quality of instruction. Favoritism and and a lack of professionalism are prevalent among some parts of management. This could be a great state university if a more forward-looking, professional team was leading the charge. Faculty and students are great for the most part, but the school feels too much like a small bubble.

review_title: Friendly environment, heavy work load, a bit isolated
pros: Fellow faculty, students. Union is helpful.
cons: State funding for higher ed is not reliable, shrinks every year, no matter who is governor.  Academic programs not the highest spending priority. Relatively little support for research.

review_title: Campus Center - Office of Student Development
job_title: Office Staff/Student Graphic Designer in Fitchburg, MA
pros: Awesome Community, Great Leadership, Awesome Career Opportunities (so long as you're an enrolled student). You work with awesome people, flexible hours.
cons: There really aren't any cons working with the Fitchburg State Campus Center. You work with awesome people.

pros: Great staff and students.  Very cooperative and east to work with team.  Lots of good communication.
cons: None that I can think of at this time.  I enjoyed being on faculty for the contract time I was there.

pros:
Great job while at college
Learned many new skills when working with the full time staff
Learned how to interact well with customers in person and over phone
cons: Having to leave after graduating College

pros: Excellent work life balance. Administration is good. Excellent classes and labs.
cons: Student are academically weak. Too many people who are just waiting to retire.

pros: Great technical support for online course creation and maintenance. Provide organizational and technical training for adjuncts.
cons: I thoroughly enjoy teaching here and do not have any cons.

Beautiful campus
